content.text:
# List of engagements during the Sudanese civil war (2023–present)

This is a list of engagements during the Sudanese civil war (2023–present).
Military situation
Battles
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
! Name
!Location
! Start date
! End date
! Result of the battle
|-
| Siege of El Fasher
|
El Fasher, North Darfur, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#86A4A5"| RSF victory
*El Fasher is captured by the Rapid Support Forces
*El Fasher massacre
*SAF's 6th Infantry Division retreat westward
*El Fasher and surrounding villages fall under total RSF control
|-
|
Battle of Khartoum (2023–2025)
|Khartoum and proximity, Khartoum State, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| SAF victory
|-
| Darfur campaign (2023–2025)
| Darfur (with spillovers into Chad and South Sudan)
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#86A4A5"| RSF victory
* Rapid Support Forces control all of South Darfur, Central Darfur, East Darfur, and West Darfur
* RSF forces capture strategic cities such as Geneina, Kabkabiya, Um Dafuq, Ed Daein, Kutum, Nyala, and El Fasher
* The Sudan Liberation Movement controls parts of Darfur including the town of Tawila
|-
| Kordofan Campaign
| Kordofan states (North, South, and West)
|
|
|
* Rapid Support Forces control most of West and North Kordofan
* SPLM-N (al-Hilu) controls parts of South Kordofan
|-
| Battle of Geneina
|Geneina
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#86A4A5"| RSF victory
|-
| Rapid Support Forces occupation of the Khartoum International Airport
| Khartoum International Airport, Khartoum, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| SAF victory
* RSF retreated from airport on 25 March 2025
|-
| Battle of Merowe Airport
|
Merowe Airport, Merowe, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| SAF victory
*RSF captures Merowe airport on April 15
*SAF captures the airport on April 19, and RSF retreats from Merowe on April 21
|-
| Battle of Nyala
|
Nyala, South Darfur, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#86A4A5"| RSF victory
*Fighting breaks out between April 15 and April 20
*Ceasefires occur between April 20 and May 5, with sporadic clashes until August 8
*RSF launches an offensive on August 11, later besieging the city
*RSF capture the infantry base of the 16th Infantry Division, effectively capturing Nyala
|-
|Siege of El Obeid
|
El Obeid, North Kordofan, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| SAF victory
*SAF repels several RSF attacks on the city between April 15 and May 23
*RSF fully besiege El Obeid by May 30
*By July, RSF come under of control the southern and western parts of the city, along with the El Obeid airport
*By September Sudanese Armed Forces recaptured the city
*On 23 February 2025, the Sudanese army fully lifts the siege of El-Obeid
|-
|Battle of Kutum
|
Kutum and Kassab refugee camp, North Darfur, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#86A4A5"| RSF victory
|-
|Battle of Kadugli
|
Kaduqli, South Kordofan State, Sudan
|
|
|
|-
|Battle of Dilling
|Dalang, South Kordofan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| Partial SAF victory
* SAF remains in control of Dilling
* Siege lifted on 24 February 2025, connecting with forces in Kadugli.
* SPLM-N and RSF remain next to the city.
|-
|Battle of Wad Madani
|
Wad Madani, Gezira State
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| SAF victory
* First Battle: RSF victory
** First Battle: RSF seizes control of Wad Madani between December 2023 and January 2025
* Second Battle: SAF victory
** Second Battle: SAF regained control of Wad Madani
***SAF continues moving north towards Khartoum
|-
|Siege of Babanusa
|
Babanusa, West Kordofan, Sudan
|
|
|
* SAF repels initial assault, controlling the city still
* Artillery clashes on 6 May 2024 kills commanders from both sides
* RSF still lays siege to the city, but major attacks have ceased.
|-
|
Capture of Al-Fulah
|
Al-Fulah and West Kordofan, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#86A4A5"| RSF victory
*RSF captures Al Fulah on June 20.
*RSF later takes control over several more villages and areas in West Kordofan.
*Sudanese army withdraws to Babanusa.
|-
|Battle of Jebel Moya
| Jebel Moya, Sennar State, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| SAF victory
*RSF captures Jebel Moya on 25 June.
*SAF recaptures the area by 5 October.
|-
|Sennar offensive
|
Sennar State
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| SAF victory
*Sudanese army recaptured most of Sennar state except small villages under RSF control, including Mazmoum.
*RSF launched incursion into Blue Nile State on 4 August 2024.
*SAF launched a counteroffensive on the rest of RSF controlled territory on 5 March 2025, and on the same day recaptured remaining RSF controlled areas located in the state, including Mazmoum and Al-Dali, leading to RSF withdrawal across the South Sudan border.
|-
|2024–2025 Bahri offensive
|
Bahri, Sudan
|
|
| align="center" style="background-color:#FFCCCC"| SAF victory
* Sudanese army and allied forces take fully control of the city of Bahri on February 17, 2025
|-
| Battle of Al Maliha
| Al Maliha, North Darfur
|
|
|
*Fighting largely ceases by June 2025
*RSF in control of the city and most of the Meidob Volcanic Field while the SAF is in control of Al Atrun
|-
|Battle of Gabal El Uweinat
|
Gabal El Uweinat, Libya–Sudan border
|6 June 2025
|16 June 2025
| align="center" style="background-color:#86A4A5"| RSF victory
* RSF and LNA take full control of the Libyan Border.
|}
